alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Snow at times heavy is forecast.

What:
Local snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 cm. Higher snowfall amounts are possible.
Risk of freezing rain.

When:
Sunday morning into late Sunday afternoon.

Additional information:
A narrow band of snow is expected, with a sharp difference in snowfall amounts from west to east. For areas that experience rain, freezing rain, or ice pellets, snowfall amounts will be reduced.

###

Motorists should expect hazardous winter driving conditions and adjust travel plans accordingly.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

affected_areas.area_description: Searchmont - Montreal River Harbour - Batchawana Bay
Sault Ste. Marie - St. Joseph Island

alerts.headline: flash freeze warning in effect
alerts.description:
Temperatures are forecast to fall rapidly. Ponding water, slush, and any falling precipitation will freeze as the temperature drops.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

alerts.headline: flash freeze warning in effect
alerts.description:
Temperatures are forecast to fall rapidly. Ponding water, slush, and any falling precipitation will freeze as the temperature drops.

What:
A combination of rain and snowmelt is expected to freeze suddenly.

When:
Overnight.

Additional information:
As a cold front moves through the area, rain is forecast to change to snow. Snow will make icy surfaces difficult to detect.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

alerts.headline: flash freeze warning ended
alerts.description:
Flash freeze conditions have ended.


###

alerts.headline: snowfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Heavy snow is forecast.

What:
Local snowfall amounts of 15 cm. Higher snowfall amounts are possible.
Risk of freezing rain.

When:
Sunday morning into Sunday evening.

Additional information:
A narrow band of significant snow is expected, with a sharp difference in snowfall amounts from west to east. For areas that experience rain, freezing rain, or ice pellets, snowfall amounts will be reduced.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, slow down, watch for tail lights ahead and be prepared to stop. Take frequent breaks and avoid strain when clearing snow.

alerts.headline: rainfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Rain, heavy at times is expected. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall.

###

Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: rainfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Rain, heavy at times is expected. The frozen ground has a reduced ability to absorb this rainfall.

What: 
Total rainfall amounts of 20 to 40 mm.

When: 
Tonight through Sunday.

Additional information: 
Showers with a risk of thunderstorms are expected.

For information concerning flooding, please consult your local Conservation Authority or Ontario Ministry of Natural Resources office. Visit Ontario.ca/floods for the latest details.

###

Localized flooding in low-lying areas is possible.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Freezing rain continues this evening.

What:
Ice build-up of 2 to 4 mm possible on some surfaces.

When:
Ending tonight.

Additional information:
Any lingering freezing rain near and east of Webequie will transition to snow tonight as temperatures rapidly drop.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

What:

Additional information:
Any freezing rain near and east of Peawanuk will transition to snow tonight.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become icy and slippery. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.

alerts.headline: freezing rain warning in effect
alerts.description:
Freezing rain continues.

What:
Ice build-up of 2 to 4 mm possible on some surfaces.

When:
Ending tonight.

Additional information:
Freezing rain near Lansdowne House and rain to the southeast of Lansdowne House will transition back to snow tonight as temperatures rapidly drop below freezing once again.

###

Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots will become icy, slippery and hazardous. Ice build-up may cause tree branches to break. Utility outages may occur.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Beware of branches or electrical wires that could break under the weight of ice.

alerts.headline: winter storm warning ended
alerts.description:
Winter storm conditions are no longer expected.


###

affected_areas.area_description: Sandy Lake - Weagamow Lake - Deer Lake

alerts.headline: winter storm warning in effect
alerts.description:
Hazardous winter conditions are expected.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.

alerts.headline: winter storm warning in effect
alerts.description:
Hazardous winter conditions are expected.

What:
Snowfall amounts up to 15 cm possible by early Sunday morning.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow and blowing snow.

When:
Tonight.

Additional information:
Snow will taper off to flurries late tonight into early Sunday morning. However, winds will remain strong Sunday near Hudson Bay with gusts up to 70 km/h, allowing blowing snow to continue, particularly over exposed areas.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Consider postponing non-essential travel until conditions improve. Take extra care when walking or driving in affected areas.
